title: Handwashing and infection prevention
content: Wash hands with soap and clean water before eating, after toilet use, and after caring for a sick person. Proper hand hygiene lowers the risk of diarrhea, respiratory infections, and food-borne illness.

title: Safe drinking water basics
content: Use boiled, filtered, or chlorinated drinking water where contamination risk exists. Store water in covered clean containers and avoid dipping unclean utensils.

title: Oral rehydration for loose motions
content: In diarrhea, give ORS and continue regular feeding. Urgent evaluation is needed if there is blood in stool, repeated vomiting, reduced urination, excessive drowsiness, or persistent fever.

title: Seasonal flu self-care and red flags
content: For mild flu-like symptoms, rest, hydrate, and monitor temperature. Seek immediate care for breathing difficulty, chest pain, confusion, or worsening symptoms in children, elderly, or pregnant people.

title: Hypertension screening guidance
content: Adults should check blood pressure regularly at PHC or community camps. Lifestyle control includes low salt intake, tobacco avoidance, physical activity, and medicine adherence if prescribed.

title: Diabetes daily care
content: Diabetes care includes regular blood sugar checks, balanced meals, activity, and prescribed medicines. Foot injury, frequent low sugar episodes, persistent vomiting, or confusion need medical review.

title: Pregnancy danger signs
content: During pregnancy, urgent referral is required for vaginal bleeding, severe abdominal pain, swelling with headache, blurred vision, reduced fetal movements, or convulsions.

title: Newborn warmth and feeding
content: Keep newborns warm, feed within one hour of birth, and exclusively breastfeed for six months. Immediate care is needed for fever, poor feeding, fast breathing, or lethargy.

title: Child vaccination importance
content: Follow the Universal Immunization schedule and keep vaccination records updated. Missed doses should be completed as soon as possible through PHC or outreach session.

title: Anemia prevention in adolescents and women
content: Regular iron-folic acid intake, deworming as advised, and iron-rich foods help reduce anemia risk. Severe fatigue, breathlessness, or palpitations require clinical assessment.

title: Mental health early support
content: Persistent sadness, sleep problems, severe anxiety, or self-harm thoughts need immediate support from trained professionals. Family support and early consultation improve recovery.

title: Tuberculosis symptom awareness
content: Cough for more than two weeks, fever, weight loss, or night sweats may indicate TB and should be tested at a government facility. Complete the full treatment course once diagnosed.

title: मधुमेह की दैनिक देखभाल
content: मधुमेह में नियमित शुगर जांच, संतुलित भोजन, शारीरिक गतिविधि और निर्धारित दवा जरूरी है। बार-बार लो शुगर, उल्टी, भ्रम या पैरों में घाव होने पर तुरंत डॉक्टर से मिलें।

title: उच्च रक्तचाप नियंत्रण
content: नमक कम लेना, तंबाकू से बचना, नियमित चलना और BP जांच उच्च रक्तचाप नियंत्रण में मदद करते हैं। सीने में दर्द, तेज सिरदर्द या धुंधला दिखना आपात स्थिति हो सकती है।

title: गर्भावस्था में खतरे के संकेत
content: गर्भावस्था में खून आना, तेज सिरदर्द, सूजन, धुंधलापन, पेट में तेज दर्द या बच्चे की हलचल कम होना गंभीर संकेत हैं। ऐसी स्थिति में तुरंत अस्पताल जाएं।
